texts.definition: Ignoring or having hidden exceptions to the algorithms determining effects of actions.
markups: <style="Definition">Ignoring or having hidden exceptions to the algorithms determining effects of actions.</style>

Players often experiences setbacks during gameplay but some setbacks can be especially bad or destroy the gameplay completely. To avoid this, game facilitators can modify the outcomes to mitigate the worse effects and possibly do this without the players knowing this. Players can also be give the possibility to create <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> but this is then typically done so it is only possible to do rarely during gameplay.
<style="H3">Examples</style>

<style="Link"><link="game-masters">Game Masters</link></style> in games such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/GURPS">GURPS</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Basic%20Role-Playing">Basic Role-Playing</link></style> can provide <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> at all times except when players roll dice to determine overcomes. Players can however also be given limited powers to recreate <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style>, the fate point system used in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%20Fantasy%20Roleplay">Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay</link></style> is an example of this, although game masters determines the effect of using these fate points.

The ''Get Out of Jail Free'' card in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Monopoly">Monopoly</link></style> is an early example of <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> under the players control. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> has similar reaction cards such as the ''moat'' card which allows players to not be affected by the adverse effects of others players cards. The card ''Counterspell'' in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style> works similarly be interrupting and removing the effect of a spell that has just been cast by other player. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Collectible%20Card%20Games">Collectible Card Games</link></style> in general can introduce such cards as balancing factors; the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Star%20Trek%20Customizable%20Card%20Game">Star Trek Customizable Card Game</link></style> went so far as to include the card ''Writ of Accountability'' which fudges the result of other players having fudged too many previous results so that these automatically lose the game.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bloodbowl">Bloodbowl</link></style> allows players to create <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> by using rerolls that are provided for the team or for specific star players.
<style="H2">Using the pattern</style>

A first decision regarding <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> is if they should be possible to create for players or by <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> by <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="game-masters">Game Masters</link></style> need to be made secretly to not impede on players' perception of having a <style="Link"><link="determinable-chance-succeed">Determinable Chance to Succeed</link></style>, e.g. through the use of <style="Link"><link="feigned-die-rolls">Feigned Die Rolls</link></style>. An exception to this is if the <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> are in itself algorithmically determined, which simply removes the pattern itself since players' can incorporate that algorithm into the normal one when it is noticed. <style="Link"><link="dynamic-difficulty-adjustment">Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment</link></style> is most often done after the fact to adjust difficult for the players' next attempt at something in the game, but can also be used to create <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> sometimes.

<style="Link"><link="self-facilitated-games">Self-Facilitated Games</link></style> let players (and possibly <style="Link"><link="game-masters">Game Masters</link></style>) create <style="CurrentLink">Fudge Results</style> when they wish due to them providing <style="Link"><link="free-game-element-manipulation">Free Game Element Manipulation</link></style> as a default. If the <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> instead are to be encoded into the rules, e.g. to empower players, this is easiest done  through <style="Link"><link="extra-chances">Extra Chances</link></style>. Another possibility is to use <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style> that provide the <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Ability</link></style> to ignore an adverse effect by being discarded (using <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>, as for example done in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Monopoly">Monopoly</link></style> or in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> with the ''moat'' card, allow these to be <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style>).

When players can perform <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> the ability to do so needs to be a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resource</link></style> for balance purposes and making <style="Link"><link="value-effort">Value of Effort</link></style> possible. They do not need to be <style="Link"><link="non-renewable-resources">Non-Renewable Resources</link></style> however, since they can be replenished as <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> (as is done for the ''fate points'' in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%20Fantasy%20Roleplay">Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay</link></style>).

<style="Link"><link="save-load-cycles">Save-Load Cycles</link></style> let players ignore all the events in play sessions, and are thus a course way of creating <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style>.

<style="Link"><link="collectible-card-games">Collectible Card Games</link></style> or other games with <style="Link"><link="evolving-rule-sets">Evolving Rule Sets</link></style> can cause players to feel that some results are <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> because they might not be aware of the presences of rules introduced.
<style="H3">Narrative Aspects</style>

Improvised <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> by <style="Link"><link="game-masters">Game Masters</link></style> can require <style="Link"><link="storytelling">Storytelling</link></style> to explain some unusual circumstance that changes the outcome. This can also introduce elements of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprise</link></style> into the game.
<style="H2">Consequences</style>

<style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> are <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style> that in a paradoxically way may in some cases be initiated by players. They typically skews <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> and the action perform by, or against, <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>. Given that <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> cannot be used too often without ruining players' <style="Link"><link="value-effort">Value of Effort</link></style>, they are quite likely to be called on in situations to hinder <style="Link"><link="life-penalties">Life Penalties</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="game-termination-penalties">Game Termination Penalties</link></style>; depending on their frequency this either modifies or cancels these patterns. These, and lesser events that may be controlled by <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style> make the pattern a way to support <style="Link"><link="social-adaptability">Social Adaptability</link></style> in a game so that players have the gameplay experience they want rather than want the game system would mechanically produce for them.

When players can create <style="CurrentLink">Fudged Results</style>, they are <style="Link"><link="facilitating-rewards">Facilitating Rewards</link></style> providing them with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empowerment">Empowerment</link></style> and quite possibly an <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>. They can also be used for <style="Link"><link="misfortune-mitigation">Misfortune Mitigation</link></style> by these players. In contrast, when created by <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style> they can instead provide <style="Link"><link="balancing-effects">Balancing Effects</link></style>. In both cases, they can provide tools for <style="Link"><link="social-roles">Social Roles</link></style> related to mediating or facilitating games.

<style="H3">Can Instantiate</style>

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Empowerment">Empowerment</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="facilitating-rewards">Facilitating Rewards</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="misfortune-mitigation">Misfortune Mitigation</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="privileged-abilities">Privileged Abilities</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="social-adaptability">Social Adaptability</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="social-roles">Social Roles</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Surprises">Surprises</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="ultra-powerful-events">Ultra-Powerful Events</link></style>
